results.title: Wagga Wagga
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”
Shows family life and the rural, industrial and commercial interests of the city of Wagga Wagga, NSW. Also covers sporting, cultural and recreational activities.

results.title: Viewpoint on Sydney
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The city of Sydney, New South Wales, as seen through the eyes of European migrants. It is seen as a big exciting city with many contrasts. Job opportunities are discussed as well as other advantages and disadvantages of living in Sydney.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Viewpoint on Brisbane
results.creator_credit: Barry Williams, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The city of Brisbane, Queensland, as seen through the eyes of European migrants. Language presents more than a communication barrier to the new arrival. It is both a handicap at work and in impediment socially. Criticism is made of officials who do not advise migrants to learn English before landing in Australia. Also discusses the easy going life style of the Queenslanders.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Williams, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Victoria: 100 years of progress
results.brief_description:
This documentary looks in detail at the history and development of Melbourne, using artist’s sketches and filmed footage to depict the history of Melbourne. Some items include the Manchester Unity Building, cars of the era travelling down St Kilda Road, St Kilda Beach, a brief history of the Princes Bridge, the Royal Botanic Gardens, Geelong and industries and transport existing in 1934. Also includes footage of the opening of Parliament.

Includes archival footage of early transport-cars; shipping; rail (Flinders Street Station); Prince’s Bridge; St. Kilda Beach; Anzac Parade; Flemington Race Course. Arrival of the Duke and Duchess of York for the first opening of Federal Parliament 1901. Also featured: scenes of the city: Collins and Swanston Streets; Melbourne Town Hill; The Exhibition Building; Parliament House and large private homes in the suburb of Toorak. Reference is made to agricultural and pastoral industries - wheat; wool production; fruit growing and tanning in Mildura. Three masted sailing vessels plus a farewell for the ocean liner Strathnaver. Finally, a re-enactment of gold mining/panning and heralding the first one hundredth birthday of the settlement of Melbourne
[SOURCE: NFSA Collection catalogue)

results.title: Valley of the Yarra
results.creator_credit: Peter McEwan, Donald Pollock, Matthias Faubel and Victorian Town and Country Planning Board
results.brief_description: Using archival stills and prints, and aerial shots the film traces the Yarra River from its source in the Great Dividing Range to its entry into Port Phillip Bay, emphasising its importance as a natural asset. Also shows geographical features such as the delta from Princes Bridge, Melbourne to Fisherman’s Bend, the port complex and various sporting facilities. Discusses the planning policy for the Yarra Valley prepared by the Town and Country Planning Board, Victoria’s state planning authority. “Modern man causes problems to this priceless asset” (Liberal Minister Dick Hamer).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter McEwan, Donald Pollock, Matthias Faubel and Victorian Town and Country Planning Board

results.title: Valley of the Yarra
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams and Australia. Dept. of the Interior. Film Division
results.brief_description: Follows the Yarra River from its source in the mountains to the busy port where it joins Port Phillip Bay. Stresses the importance of the Yarra in the supply of water for Melbourne. Shows farmlands and towns, landscapes and scenery along the river as it goes through to Melbourne.

results.title: The Unlucky country
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Denys Brown and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: South Vietnam, a developing country facing the process of improving standards of living, health and education, against a background of constant dissension and war - the dual objectives to win a war and develop a country. Discusses the role of Australian Task Forces in establishing security and providing aid for civil development. Shows the work of the three medical teams.

results.title: Facts
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”.
A change in working hours upsets the workers at a factory and Dixon, the Union delegate, is asked to report the change to the union office. In his report to the organiser, Dixon manages to bring in all sorts of irrelevancies but is very short on accurate information. This film manages to pinpoint an area of possible confusion if union delegates fail to get the facts straight.

results.title: Understanding the car
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”
Some knowledge of how a car works is a good basis for the intelligent use of its controls, and that is an early important step towards becoming a good driver. A car is built, pictorially, in simple stages, and how each component operates is explained in simple terms.
